meanings.definition: A demonstration or public display of a product or skill.
meanings.sent1: During the science class, the teacher gave a demo of the volcano experiment.
meanings.sent2: The company organized a demo to showcase their new software to potential clients.
meanings.sent3: At the fair, the magician's demo of card tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The artist's demo of painting techniques was like watching magic on canvas.
meanings.sent5: The demo of martial arts by the instructor left everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: A recording or performance intended to showcase the abilities of an artist or musician.
meanings.sent1: The singer's demo tape impressed the record label executives.
meanings.sent2: The band decided to release a demo of their latest song online.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's demo of jokes had the audience laughing non-stop.
meanings.sent4: The guitarist's demo of skills on stage was electrifying.
meanings.sent5: Listening to the pianist's demo made me appreciate music even more.

meanings.definition: A shortened form of the word 'demonstration'.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to watch a demo of the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The software developer created a demo to showcase the app's features.
meanings.sent3: The quick demo of the new game left the players excited to try it out.
meanings.sent4: The chef's demo of the recipe made cooking look easy.
meanings.sent5: The demo of the dance routine was a hit at the talent show.
